Neg, # 1622

Old Gas lamp post at Madison Sq., N.Y. 1884
Arm of the Statue of Liberty on display in Madison Sq. Park (during campaign to raise funds for its erection in 1886)
Looking up 5th Ave.
At left, Broadway

Photograph by Brown Brothers
220 West 42nd St.
New York City

Fifth Avenue and Broadway, north from 23rd Street and environs. From left to right respectively are Broadway, Fifth Avenue, Madison Square (Park) and the well known amusement center, Madison Square Garden. E. 26th Street forms the northerly rim of the park. In the right foreground is the seated statue of William Seward, Sec'y of State in President Lincoln's cabinet. The Worth monument is at the triangular apex formed by Broadway and Fifth Avenue. Prominent on the latter thoroughfare are, the Marble Collegiate Church, the Hotel Waldorf-Astoria and the Brick Presbyterian Church.

1893

J. S. Johnston, photo
Copyright 1894
Ewing Galloway

Celebrations, Parades and Municipal Events: The Decoration Day Parade passing the Columbian Bell at the Worth Monument. The marchers are on Fifth Avenue while Broadway forms the left background. This photo is a companion to those that appeared on page 698 of the June 16, 1894 issue of the Illustrated American. Vol. 15.

May 30, 1894.

The Illustrated American
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Decoration Day Parade.

text:
General Views:

(1) Tower of Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, at left on Madison, at right Flatiron Building at intersection of Fifth Avenue and Broadway, looking south.

(2) Madison Square looking west across Fifth Avenue. Flatiron Building shown at intersection of Broadway and Fifth Avenue.
